name: New AWS Account creation SOP [WIP].txt - Introduction
description: This section outlines the initial steps required for creating a new AWS account. It involves presenting the agenda and requirements to the relevant teams, such as DevOps, and obtaining approval from the Finance department by providing a cost estimation for the necessary services. This process ensures that all stakeholders are informed and aligned before proceeding with the account creation.
use_cases: Obtaining approval from relevant teams for creating a new AWS account
Presenting cost estimation to Finance department for required services

name: New AWS Account creation SOP [WIP].txt - Process Steps
description: This section outlines the steps involved in creating a new AWS account within an organization. It involves requesting assistance from the root account credentials holder of the AWS production account (141592612890) to create the account within the organization. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of collaborating with the DevOps Security team to remove any default vulnerable configurations and secure the account before proceeding with further actions. This process aims to ensure proper security measures are in place from the outset.
use_cases: Creating a new AWS account within an organization
Securing the new AWS account by removing default vulnerable configurations
Collaborating with different teams (root account holder and DevOps Security) for account creation and security hardening
capabilities: AWS account creation within an organization
Customization of VPC and CIDR settings

name: New AWS Account creation SOP [WIP].txt - Security Considerations
description: This section outlines important security considerations when creating a new AWS account. It emphasizes the need to configure multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user, which adds an extra layer of security to prevent unauthorized access. Additionally, it recommends removing default security group rules and enabling automatic encryption for new EBS volumes to enhance data protection and comply with security best practices.
use_cases: Securing root user access with MFA
Enabling data encryption for EBS volumes
